formElement.label: Configuration
formElement.documentation: Name of the configuration to be used. URL, port and credentials are retrieved from the given configuration. To view or create a new configuration, go to the Administration -> Plugins tab, and select 'Configure' action for @PLUGIN_KEY@ plugin.
formElement.htmlDocumentation: Name of the configuration to be used. URL, port and credentials are retrieved from the given configuration.

formElement.label: WLST script absolute path
formElement.documentation: Absolute path to WLST. i.e: '/path/to/wlst.cmd' or 'wlst.sh'.

formElement.label: Datasource name
formElement.documentation: A unique name that identifies this Datasource in the WebLogic domain.

formElement.label: Database
formElement.documentation: The database used by the Datasource.

formElement.label: Server Instance
formElement.documentation: Instance name of the Server to include the Datasource. i.e: 'AdminServer'.

formElement.label: Datasource JNDI
formElement.documentation: The JNDI path to where this Datasource is bound. By default, the JNDI name is the name of the Datasource. Applications that look up the JNDI path will get a "javax.sql.Datasource" instance that corresponds to this Datasource.

formElement.label: Datasource Driver Class
formElement.documentation: The full package name of JDBC driver class used to create the physical database connections in the connection pool. (Note that this driver class must be in the classpath of any server to which it is deployed).

formElement.label: Datasource URL
formElement.documentation: The URL of the database to connect to. The format of the URL varies by JDBC driver. The URL is passed to the JDBC driver to create the physical database connections.

formElement.label: Database User
formElement.documentation: The user to connect to the database.

formElement.label: Database Password
formElement.documentation: The password attribute passed to the JDBC driver when creating physical database connections. The value is stored in an encrypted form in the descriptor file and when displayed on the Administration Console.
